title: Data & Database Fundamentals
subtitle: Relational database concepts, data types, schema design, indexes and ACID properties
skillsGained: Master relational database fundamentals and ACID properties
Understand data types, schema design, and normalization principles
Learn indexing strategies for optimal query performance
Distinguish between OLTP and OLAP systems
Apply database design best practices in real-world scenarios

title: SQL & ELT Concepts
subtitle: SQL fundamentals, advanced queries, window functions, and ELT paradigm
skillsGained: Master advanced SQL techniques including joins, CTEs, and window functions
Understand ELT vs ETL paradigms and when to use each approach
Optimize SQL queries for performance in large datasets
Apply SQL best practices for data transformation workflows
Design efficient data processing pipelines using SQL

title: Data Warehousing Principles
subtitle: Data warehouse architecture, loading patterns, and data quality principles
skillsGained: Understand data warehouse architecture and design principles
Master ETL/ELT loading patterns and batch processing techniques
Implement data quality frameworks and validation processes
Design dimensional models for analytical workloads
Apply governance and security best practices

title: Data Modeling
subtitle: Dimensional modeling, star schemas, slowly changing dimensions, and ERDs
skillsGained: Master dimensional modeling techniques for analytical systems
Design and implement star and snowflake schemas
Handle slowly changing dimensions with various SCD types
Create comprehensive entity relationship diagrams
Apply data modeling best practices for enterprise systems

title: Snowflake-Specific Knowledge
subtitle: Snowflake architecture, virtual warehouses, data loading, and optimization
skillsGained: Master Snowflake's unique architecture and components
Configure and optimize virtual warehouses for different workloads
Implement efficient data loading strategies in Snowflake
Apply Snowflake-specific performance optimization techniques
Understand Snowflake security and governance features

title: ETL/ELT Design & Best Practices
subtitle: Pipeline design principles, transformation patterns, and incremental loading
skillsGained: Design robust and scalable ETL/ELT pipelines
Implement advanced transformation patterns and techniques
Master incremental loading strategies for efficient processing
Establish data lineage and impact analysis capabilities
Apply pipeline design best practices for maintainability

title: Data Governance, Quality & Metadata
subtitle: Data governance principles, quality implementation, and testing strategies
skillsGained: Establish comprehensive data governance frameworks
Implement automated data quality monitoring systems
Design and execute data testing strategies
Manage metadata and data catalog systems
Apply compliance and regulatory requirements

title: Snowflake Security & Access Control
subtitle: Authentication, authorization, RBAC, and security best practices
skillsGained: Implement robust authentication and authorization systems
Configure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) in Snowflake
Apply security policies and compliance requirements
Manage user access and privilege escalation
Monitor and audit security events and access patterns

title: Reporting & BI Concepts
subtitle: BI tools, ThoughtSpot, visualization design, and semantic layers
skillsGained: Master business intelligence tools and platforms
Design effective visualizations and dashboards
Implement semantic layers for business users
Optimize reporting performance and user experience
Apply BI best practices for enterprise deployments

title: Unix/Linux & File Handling
subtitle: Unix fundamentals, shell scripting, file processing, and log analysis
skillsGained: Master Unix/Linux command line operations
Write efficient shell scripts for automation
Process large files and perform data manipulation
Analyze log files and extract meaningful insights
Apply Unix tools for data engineering workflows
